intro: Gaultheria antipoda, commonly known as the New Zealand wintergreen, is a species of shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible and contain a high concentration of aromatic oils. Gaultheria antipoda thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a notable plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
